title: Sooronbay Jeenbekov - Wikipedia
snippet: As president, Jeenbekov dealt with issues specifically in foreign policy and corruption in which several juridical reforms were implemented to improve public trust. In spite of that, Kyrgyzstan under Jeenbekov faced a growth of organised crime and government corruption and lack of economic development which was negatively affected upon the COVID-19 pandemic and was accused of downplaying the alleged cases of electoral fraud in the 2020 parliamentary election that resulted in the 2020 Kyrgyz Revolution and his resignation amidst political unrest over the disputed election results.

title: Presidency of Sooronbay Jeenbekov
snippet: Sooronbay Jeenbekov became Kyrgyzstan's president on November 24, 2017, marking the country's first peaceful transfer of power from one elected leader to another. His inaugural decree honored his p

title: Sooronbay Jeenbekov facts for kids
snippet: Sooronbay Sharip uulu Jeenbekov (born 16 November 1958) is a politician from Kyrgyzstan. He was the fifth president of Kyrgyzstan from 2017 until he stepped down in 2020. This happened after a week of protests in the country.

title: Sooronbay Jeenbekov
snippet: During his presidency, Sooronbay Jeenbekov prioritized rural development, declaring 2018 the Year of Regional Development to address regional imbalances in an agrarian economy where approximately 70% of the population resides in rural areas.[29][30] This initiative sought to modernize agriculture through support for cooperatives, cluster-based approaches, and organic farming, alongside efforts to boost exports of agricultural products via targeted government resolutions and fund allocations.[31][32] In April 2018, Jeenbekov ratified a $25.4 million loan from the International Fund for Agricult
